standard_names.name: Earth System Modeling Standard Name Library

section.name: base_names
section.comment:
Base names are the 'elemental' quantities from which
 the more complex standard names are constructed.
 Base names can roughly be broken down into three categories:

section.name: generic_names
section.comment:
The following names are too general to be chosen as
 standard names, but they can serve as base names for
 more specific standard names.

standard_name.name: area_fraction
standard_name.description: The fraction of an area where some condition applies

standard_name.name: binary_mask
standard_name.description: A field consisting of either 0 or 1 at every point

standard_name.name: coefficient
standard_name.description: A real number used in a mathematical equation, typically derived empirically and/or adjusted based on some other physical phenomenon to change the behavior of an equation, scheme, or other modeling unit

standard_name.name: density
standard_name.description: Mass per unit volume

standard_name.name: energy_content
standard_name.description: Total energy within some surface

standard_name.name: energy_density
standard_name.description: Total energy within some volume

standard_name.name: frequency
standard_name.description: Number of instances per unit time

standard_name.name: heat_flux
standard_name.description: The amount of heat traveling through an area per unit time

standard_name.name: heat_transport
standard_name.description: Movement of heat due to advection

standard_name.name: mass_content
standard_name.description: Vertically-integrated mass over a given area and vertical extent

standard_name.name: mass_flux
standard_name.description: Mass traveling through an area per unit time

standard_name.name: mass_fraction
standard_name.description: The fraction of a given mass where some condition applies

standard_name.name: mass_transport
standard_name.description: Movement of some specified mass by advection

standard_name.name: mixing_ratio
standard_name.description: A ratio of the amount of one substance to another; when unqualified refers to the ratio of the mass of one substance to the total mass in a given volume
standard_name.comment: See Standard Name Rules for further details about disambiguation of this term

standard_name.name: mole_fraction
standard_name.description: The ratio of the number of molecules or atoms of a substance to the total number of molecules/atoms in a given volume

standard_name.name: mole_flux
standard_name.description: The number of molecules or atoms of a substance traveling through an area per unit time

standard_name.name: momentum_flux
standard_name.description: The transfer of momentum through an area per unit time

standard_name.name: partial_pressure
standard_name.description: The pressure of a component gas independent of other components

standard_name.name: period
standard_name.description: The amount of time between regular events

standard_name.name: power
standard_name.description: Energy per unit time

standard_name.name: pressure
standard_name.description: Force per unit area

standard_name.name: probability
standard_name.description: A real number between 0 and 1 indicating the likelihood of an event occurring

standard_name.name: radiative_flux
standard_name.description: The amount of radiative energy traveling through an area per unit time

standard_name.name: radius
standard_name.description: Distance from the center to the perimeter of a circle or sphere

standard_name.name: speed
standard_name.description: Directionless distance per unit time

standard_name.name: stress
standard_name.description: A deformation force across a unit area

standard_name.name: thickness
standard_name.description: The vertical distance between two constant-pressure surfaces

standard_name.name: velocity
standard_name.description: Distance per unit time

standard_name.name: velocity_potential
standard_name.description: A scalar function with its gradient equal to the velocity vector of an irrotational flow

standard_name.name: volume_flux
standard_name.description: The movement of a volume of a substance across a unit area per unit time

standard_name.name: volume_fraction
standard_name.description: The fraction of a volume where some condition applies

standard_name.name: volume_mixing_ratio
standard_name.description: A ratio of the number of molecules or atoms of a substance to another in a unit volume

standard_name.name: volume_transport
standard_name.description: Movement of some volume of a specified substance by advection

standard_name.name: vorticity
standard_name.description: The curl of a velocity vector

These names are used as bases for other names, but may
 also be considered standard names on their own. See the
 full list of standard names for further details.

standard_name.name: momentum_flux

standard_name.name: roughness_length

standard_name.name: soil_moisture

standard_name.name: solar_declination_angle

standard_name.name: solar_zenith_angle

standard_name.name: surface_skin_temperature

standard_name.name: temperature_flux

standard_name.name: total_water

standard_name.name: tracer
standard_name.description: A hypothetical zero-mass particle that is advected in fluid flow

standard_name.name: tke

standard_name.name: virtual_potential_temperature

standard_name.name: virtual_temperature

standard_name.name: water_vapor

standard_name.name: wind

standard_name.description: Shear stress exerted by wind parallel to the surface

standard_name.name: wind_speed

section.name: dimensions
section.comment:
Dimension standard names may come in sets of six related standard names for each dimension:
 ```
 [dim_name]_dimension -- The full dimension size
 [dim_name]_loop_extent -- Size of dim for current call
 [dim_name]_begin - Start index for dimension
 [dim_name]_end - End index for dimension
 [dim_name]_index - Single index for dimension
 [dim_name]_selection - Array of selected indices for dimension
 ```
 Note that the cap generator may substitute among standard names in this category in order to properly call suite parts and individual schemes. In the substitutions below, the name on the left is the standard_name in the dimensions field of the caller while the name(s) on the right is (are) the standard name(s) of the callee (in the form used in the subroutine call).
 ```
 [dim_name]_dimension ==> 1:[dim_name]_loop_extent
 [dim_name]_loop_extent ==> 1:[dim_name]_loop_extent
 [dim_name]_begin:[dim_name]_end ==> 1:[dim_name]_loop_extent
 [dim_name]_begin:[dim_name]_end ==> 1:[dim_name]_dimension
 ```
 Also note that horizontal_dimension should be used in xxx_[timestep_]init and xxx_[timestep_]final routines but not in xxx_run routines.
 Currently, the only dimension which supports all six dimension types is horizontal_dimension. This and other supported dimension standard names are listed below.

standard_name.name: horizontal_dimension
standard_name.description: Size horizontal dimension

standard_name.name: vertical_layer_dimension
standard_name.description: number of vertical layers

standard_name.name: vertical_layer_dimension_extended_up_by_1
standard_name.description: number of vertical layers extended up by 1

standard_name.name: vertical_interface_dimension
standard_name.description: number of vertical interfaces

standard_name.name: vertical_layer_index
standard_name.description: index of a particular vertical layer

standard_name.name: vertical_interface_index
standard_name.description: index of a particular vertical interface

standard_name.name: number_of_openmp_threads
standard_name.description: Total number of thread blocks OpenMP (shared-memory) parallel threads.
